data.event: What is now California was first settled by various Native American tribes before being explored by a number of European expeditions during the 16th and 17th centuries.

event.title: explored by a number of European expeditions during the 16th and 17th centuries

data.event: What is now California was first settled by various Native American tribes before being explored by a number of European expeditions during the 16th and 17th centuries.

event.title: became a part of Mexico in 1821

data.event: Alta California became a part of Mexico in 1821 following its successful war for independence, but was ceded to the United States in 1848 after the Mexican–American War.

event.title: was ceded to the United States in 1848

data.event: Alta California became a part of Mexico in 1821 following its successful war for independence, but was ceded to the United States in 1848 after the Mexican–American War.

event.title: was admitted as the 31st state on September 9, 1850

data.event: The western portion of Alta California was organized as the State of California, which was admitted as the 31st state on September 9, 1850.
The California Gold Rush starting in 1848 led to dramatic social and demographic change, with large-scale immigration from the east and abroad with an accompanying economic boom.
